column2: Area 1: Understanding of Issues of Local, Regional and Global Significance
a.	Identify and gather relevant  information and ideas through independent research
b.	Consider various perspectives on issues, including the Singapore perspective
c.	Critically examine the significance of issues on the individual, our society, our region and the world
d.	Synthesise ideas across issues and develop conceptual understanding
Area 2: Critical and Inventive Thinking
Analysis
a.	Identify the components of a text and how they relate to one another
b.	Infer meanings
	making connections and recognising patterns across ideas
	probing/uncovering implicit claims and assumptions
	determining the writer’s/speaker’s intended purpose
	determining the writer’s/speaker’s tone
Evaluation
a.	Assess the accuracy and credibility of information or its source
b.	Assess the cogency of an argument
c.	Assess the significance of an argument and its implications and consequences
Creation
a.	Synthesise ideas, arguments and/or evidence from various sources
b.	Generate ideas both individually and collaboratively
c.	Apply and adapt ideas to other contexts
Area 3: English Language for Effective Communication
a.	Understand and demonstrate how the organisation and development of ideas communicate a stance
b.	Understand and demonstrate how the appropriate use of language contributes to persuasion, effective expression of ideas and an informed and insightful personal response
c.	Understand and demonstrate how the review and revision of ideas and language use enhance relevance and clarity in the expression of ideas and an informed and insightful personal response
